subject: Unable to post to MockObjects.org users mailing list
msgSnippet: Hi all, I am having trouble communicating my experiences with the software located at www.MockObjects.com.  I ve used it a bit in IBM VAJ, and really like it
messageBody:
Hi all,

I am having trouble communicating my experiences with the software
located at www.MockObjects.com. I've used it a bit in IBM VAJ, and
really like it so far, but it would be great if I could interact with
other users of this software, since alot of aspects of usage are
still pretty unclear. But I cannot seem to find link or button in
the SourceForge page for posting to the list from the list archive
page, even though the preceeding page clearly says 'Choose a list to
browse, search, and post messages'.

I realize I may very well be missing something very simple that when
explained to me will make me feel quite dumb. On the other hand, I
don't see very many postings in that public user list, so perhaps
something there is broken?

Is anyone else having similar frustrations, or is it just me? The
EasyMock alternative, I think, requires jdk 1.3, which IBM VAJ does
not yet support, so I was hoping to bank on the MockObjects framework
to provide much needed help in building my unit-tests.
